fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

 
 The new Atlassian App Migration Platform (currently under development) will enable all Atlassian Marketplace Partners apps to build automated/assisted migration paths for their apps.

[Connector for Salesforce & Jira |https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1214214/connector-for-salesforce-jira?hosting=cloud&tab=overview]is a popular app that is available on DC, Server, and Cloud platform, however, there is no published migration path between the Server/DC version and the Cloud version.
h3. Suggested Solution

 
 When a customer migrates projects from Jira Server / Data Centre to Jira Cloud using the Jira Cloud Migration Assistant (JCMA), the app migration platform will coordinate with ServiceRocket to automatically relocate all connections, bindings, associations information and etc.
h3. Current Status

The migration path of the connector with JCMA is currently in progress and our current target release date is End of March/Early April.
 At the same time, we are collecting the requirements from the existing Server & Data Center customers for the migration functionality.
 Please reach out to me aidin(at)servicerocket(dot)com if you'd like to share your requirements or simply drop a comment here.
fields.summary: Migration path to Cloud for Connector for Salesforce & Jira (NextGen)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
CCMA migration gets stuck when an app is selected in the UI.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to app assessment
 # Mark an app with an automated path as "Needed in cloud"
# Create a migration
# Select to migrate apps
# Run the migration

h3. Expected Results
# Core product migration completes
# Selected app is triggered
# App can report progress

h3. Actual Results
# Core product migration doesn't start. 

h3. Workaround

No workaround so far.
fields.summary: CCMA migration gets stuck when an app is selected in the user interface

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
User migration step failed intermittently with

Caused by: com.atlassian.jira.migration.httpclient.exceptions.UnexpectedStatusCodeException: Received an unexpected status code; expected [200], but received 403: 
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce

When you select scoped user migration for significantly large projects.

User migration finished successfully.

h3. Actual Results
Failed with

com.atlassian.jira.migration.httpclient.exceptions.UnexpectedStatusCodeException: Received an unexpected status code; expected [200], but received 403: *strong text*
{code}


The above exception is thrown in the Jira log file:
{noformat}
...
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

 
 The new Atlassian App Migration Platform (currently under development) will enable all Atlassian Marketplace Partners apps to build automated migration paths for their apps.
h3. Suggested Solution

 
 When a customer migrates projects from Confluence Server / Data Centre to Confluence Cloud using the Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant, the app migration platform will coordinate with ServiceRocket to automatically move [Security and Encryption for Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/6484/security-and-encryption-for-confluence?hosting=server&tab=overview] by ServiceRocket data associated with the migrated projects.
h3. Current Status

 
 While the app is also [available on Cloud|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/6484/security-and-encryption-for-confluence?hosting=cloud&tab=overview], there is *no direct migration* path is available. This is due largely to security implications and technical limitations as the app deal with security matters which may make it impossible to migrate the encrypted data into the Cloud. A workaround is to manually migrate the data into Cloud.

More information about notable feature differences between Server/Data Center vs Cloud can be found here:

* [Security and Encryption for Confluence Feature Differences|https://docs.servicerocket.com/x/7YasCw]

Please find the documentation below to help prepare the manual migration:

* [Migration of Security & Encryption Confluence from Server to Cloud is currently not supported but we can help...|https://docs.servicerocket.com/x/GYKsCw]

We are tracking the interest on an automatic migration. If this were to change and a migration path is available in the future then we will update the tracker below:
 
* [https://ideas.atlassian.servicerocket.com/ideas/SEC-I-62]
fields.summary: Support migration of Security and Encryption for Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

 
 The new Atlassian App Migration Platform (currently under development) will enable all Atlassian Marketplace Partners apps to build automated migration paths for their apps.
h3. Suggested Solution

 
 When a customer migrates projects from Confluence Server / Data Centre to Confluence Cloud using the Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant, the app migration platform will coordinate with ServiceRocket to automatically move [Scaffolding Forms & Templates|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/190/scaffolding-forms-templates?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] by ServiceRocket data associated with the migrated projects.
h3. Current Status

Migration path with Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant *EAP/Beta* is *available now by upgrading to Scaffolding version 8.25.0

Read more about Migrating Scaffolding from the following documentation:
* [Scaffolding Forms & Templates Feature Differences|https://docs.servicerocket.com/x/IYasCw]
* [Migrating from Scaffolding Server to Scaffolding Cloud|https://docs.servicerocket.com/x/A4OsCw]
fields.summary: Support migration of Scaffolding Forms & Templates

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The new Atlassian App Migration Platform (currently under development) will enable all Atlassian Marketplace Partners apps to build automated migration paths for their apps.
h3. Suggested Solution

When a customer migrates projects from Confluence Server / Data Centre to Confluence Cloud using the Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant, the app migration platform will coordinate with ServiceRocket to automatically move [Connector for Salesforce & Confluence Server|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/241/connector-for-salesforce-confluence-server-data-center?hosting=server&tab=overview] data associated with the migrated projects.
h3. Current Status

While a Cloud equivalent app is available on the marketplace ([Connector for Salesforce & Confluence Cloud|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1214213/connector-for-salesforce-confluence-cloud?hosting=cloud&tab=overview]), there is no migration path available.
ServiceRocket team is currently collecting the requirements from the existing Server & Data Center customers for the migration functionality.
h3. Workaround

While it is possible to migrate manually, which takes time and may be subject to data loss. Please reach out to our [support team|https://servicerocket.drift.click/ffd28687-47bc-4c44-ab36-d94d4dcc3198] if you urgently need to migrate to the Cloud.
fields.summary: Support migration of Connector for Salesforce & Confluence Server

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition

The new Atlassian App Migration Platform (currently under development) will enable all Atlassian Marketplace Partners apps to build automated migration paths for their apps.
h3. Solution

Migration path for [Linking for Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/166/linking-for-confluence?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] by ServiceRocket already works out of the box by using [Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence-cloud-migration-assistant-973486571.html] or Space exports.

However, not all macros and macro parameters are available in Cloud. Check the [differences|https://docs.servicerocket.com/linking/macro-reference] and [Migration FAQ|https://docs.servicerocket.com/linking/macro-reference/faq-on-confluence-server-to-confluence-cloud-migration] page.

More details:
 * Currently, only [Add Page|https://docs.servicerocket.com/linking/macro-reference/add-page] and [Add Page via Form|https://docs.servicerocket.com/linking/macro-reference/add-page-via-form] macros available in Cloud and can be migrated
 ** While all data will be migrated, only some server-version parameters of these macros are available in Cloud. 
 * Let us know if there are any Server Linking macros that you would like to see in Cloud from this [ongoing survey|https://servicerocket.typeform.com/to/fxpMyUrV]
fields.summary: Support the migration of Linking for Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When issues are imported using JSON import, history of issues is not persisted.

This means that JQLs like `status was STH` are not imported.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Import issues containing history items using JSON importer 

h3. Expected Results

History of issues is saved.
h3. Actual Results

History is not saved.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: JSON import does not import history items

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the Jira Cloud Migration Assistant, latest version 1.4.8, there is a dependency on Jira Software being installed, otherwise, the assistant will not startup.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Jira server with Jira Core only
# Install the Jira Cloud Migration assistant
# Start the app

h3. Expected Results

The app would start normally.

h3. Actual Results

The app fails to start with dependency error:

 !JCMA Disabled.jpg|thumbnail! 

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
 /rest/plugins/1.0/com.atlassian.jira.migration.jira-migration-plugin-key [c.a.p.osgi.factory.OsgiPlugin] Unable to start the plugin container for plugin 'com.atlassian.jira.migration.jira-migration-plugin'
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: com/atlassian/greenhopper/model/rapid/RapidView
        at java.lang.Class.getDeclaredMethods0(Native Method)
        at java.lang.Class.privateGetDeclaredMethods(Class.java:2701)
        at java.lang.Class.getDeclaredMethods(Class.java:1975)
org.springframework.util.ReflectionUtils.getDeclaredMethods(ReflectionUtils.java:609)
        at org.springframework.util.ReflectionUtils.doWithMethods(ReflectionUtils.java:521)
        at org.springframework.util.ReflectionUtils.doWithMethods(ReflectionUtils.java:507)
....
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.atlassian.greenhopper.model.rapid.RapidView not found by com.atlassian.jira.migration.jira-migration-plugin [230]
org.apache.felix.framework.BundleWiringImpl.findClassOrResourceByDelegation(BundleWiringImpl.java:1532)
        at org.apache.felix.framework.BundleWiringImpl.access$400(BundleWiringImpl.java:75)
org.apache.felix.framework.BundleWiringImpl$BundleClassLoader.loadClass(BundleWiringImpl.java:1955)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:357)
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Install Jira Software if possible and if you have any issues, please, contact [Atlassian support|http://support.atlassian.com].
fields.summary: JCMA fail to start due to missing dependency

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When performing a migration with the JCMA from server to cloud, the context of the custom field Story Points on the cloud instance gets modified by the JCMA.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On the cloud instance set the Story Points field to have *Global context*
 # On the server instance, set the Story Points context to be applicable to only some issue types
# Create some issues on a test project and migrate them to cloud

h3. Expected Results
The cloud custom field context will retain its configurations and the migrated issue types should be included in the context they belong to.

h3. Actual Results
The JCMA creates a separate context for the migrated issue types that belong to the server custom field context.

h4. Story Points context originally on cloud
 !Screen Shot 2021-02-17 at 16.50.46.png|thumbnail! 

h4. Story Points context on server
 !Screen Shot 2021-02-17 at 16.50.54.png|thumbnail! 

h4. Story Points context on cloud after the migration
 !Screen Shot 2021-02-17 at 16.52.05.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Reconfiguring the cloud custom field context to the previous one it had.
fields.summary: The cloud custom field context configuration for the "Story Points" field gets altered by the JCMA

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When doing a site import for Jira, you may notice that you are missing the Automation panel from the Jira system menu.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a backup of Jira
# Import in a Cloud instance

h3. Expected Results

The automation menu would be there.

 !Screen Shot 2021-02-16 at 18.31.45.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

The menu is not present in Jira -> System.

 !Screen Shot 2021-02-16 at 18.38.38.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround

There is no workaround for this issue, please, [contact Atlassian support|http://support.atlassian.com].

h3. Notes

The Automation 4 Jira, as well as Code Barell, was acquired by Atlassian and thus it was incorporated into Jira Cloud's out-of-the-box version. This problem requires support to reinstall the automation app.
fields.summary: After a Jira site import the automation menu disappears

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The customer wants to get the URL mapping information(corresponding Server and Cloud URL) between Confluence Server and Confluence Cloud after migration.
Like this:

{code}
spaceKey,page Title,Server pageId,Server URL,Cloud pageId,Cloud URL
MAP2,page2,1212434,http://confluence-macbook-pro.local:41235/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=1212434,410812424,https://cloudconfluence.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/MAP2/pages/410812424/page2
MAP2,page1,1212435,http://confluence-macbook-pro.local:41235/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=1212435,410812423,https://cloudconfluence.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/MAP2/pages/410812423/page1
{code}

Confluence pageId is changed after the migration, so it is difficult to find the corresponding cloud page URL.

h4. Situation
- The customer's Confluence Server pages are on public.
- *Their customers* know that Server page URL(not confluence link. just string).
- After the migration Server to Cloud, the Cloud page URL will be changed from Server(pageId, baseUrl, etc.).
- However, *their customers* only know the Server page URL. So the customer wants to configure the redirection to Cloud in Confluence Server page URL.
- To configure that redirection, the customer needs to get the mapping of how changed page URL(Server to Cloud) to configure the redirection.

h3. Suggested Solution

- Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant(CCMA) provides that URL mapping information after the migration is completed.

h3. Workaround

- There is no workaround now, please consult with Atlassian support.
fields.summary: Provide the corresponding URL information between Confluence Server and Confluence Cloud after migration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira Projects with an underscore in the project key gets migrated with Jira Cloud Migration Assistant

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Migrate a project with an underscore in the project key. 
 # Jira Cloud Migration Assistant will migrate the project

h3. Expected Results
* You can browse the issues without any problems

h3. Actual Results
* Issues can be viewed in old issue view 
* Issues cannot be seen in new issue view. 
 !underscore.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
* Change the project key in the project in cloud to remove the underscore from the project key.
fields.summary: Jira Projects with an underscore in the project key gets migrated with JCMA

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The new Atlassian App Migration Platform (currently under development) will enable all Atlassian Marketplace Partners apps to build automated migration paths for their apps.
h3. Solution

When a customer migrates projects from Confluence Server / Data Centre to Confluence Cloud using the Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant, the app migration platform will coordinate with ServiceRocket to automatically move [Composition Tabs|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/245/composition-tabs-for-confluence?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] by ServiceRocket data associated with the migrated projects.
h3. Current Status
 * Migration for [Showcase|https://docs.servicerocket.com/composition/macro-reference/showcase] macros already works out of the box by using [Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence-cloud-migration-assistant-973486571.html] or Space exports.
 * Migration for Tabbed Content macros ([Deck of Cards|https://docs.servicerocket.com/composition/macro-reference/deck-of-cards] & [Card|https://docs.servicerocket.com/composition/macro-reference/card]) works out of the box by using [Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence-cloud-migration-assistant-973486571.html] or Space exports. However, a pre-requisite step must be done on the Confluence server side. See [Migrating Deck & Card macros to Cloud|https://docs.servicerocket.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=183540069]
 * Other Composition macros may not be available in Cloud. Check the following documentation:
 ** [Feature differences|https://docs.servicerocket.com/x/b4isCw]
 ** [Migration path|https://docs.servicerocket.com/x/5ICsCw]
 ** Nested bodied macros are not supported in Cloud.
 * Please reach out to our [support team|https://servicerocket.drift.click/ffd28687-47bc-4c44-ab36-d94d4dcc3198] if you are facing any issue
fields.summary: Support migration of ServiceRocket Composition Tabs for Confluence

There is no workaround

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users created during the CSV file import are not set as inactive, even though it is selected during the import process.

!External_System_Import.png!

The created users are active and have default product access.
 If default product access is enabled for some products, this can cause changes to the licensed user count on the site.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Settings > System > External System Import
 # Import issues using a CSV file and containing the email addresses of non-existing users as the reporter.
 # During the import process when asked about created users, select "Leave them as inactive for now, these can be changed in User Management section later."

h3. Expected Results

The users are created without site access.
h3. Actual Results

The users are created with site access.
h3. Workaround

*Option 1*
 Select *Set their application access manually* during the import. Make sure no products are checked.

!no_product_access.png!

*Option 2*
 Disable default product access by toggling off *New users have access to this product* under *Product access* on the site settings page.
fields.summary: Users created by CSV file import are not set as inactive

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using JCMA to migrate projects using the option "All users and groups from the Jira Directory" users may see this error:

*Multiple users have the same email address*
 This is caused by the duplicate email check. If users have the same email address in two different directories, but in one of them there's a difference between some characters, the JCMA marks those as duplicates.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # access JCMA GUI <Server_URL>/secure/migration-app-action.jspa#/plan-configuration
 # select "chose what to migrate"
 # select "Projects, users and groups"
 # select desired projects
 # select "All users and groups from the Jira Directory"
 # select "Preserve Group Membership"
 # users should see the ERROR *"Multiple users have the same email address"*

h3. Expected Results
Users should be able to complete the migration of projects and users via the JCMA.

h3. Actual Results
Users may see the error below:
 !Image 2021-02-02 at 2.32.18 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Edit the users' email addresses on the internal directory to reflect the same email address from the external directory.
fields.summary: Duplicate email check fails when email address has some upper case characters

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The new Atlassian App Migration Platform (currently under development) will enable all Atlassian Marketplace Partners apps to build automated migration paths for their apps.
h3. Suggested Solution

K15t's new-generation app *Scroll Documents* is our solution for authoring translated content and technical communication in Confluence on all deployment types. A content migration from Scroll Translations-managed spaces to Scroll Documents will provided as a feature of Scroll Translations.

When a customer migrates from Confluence Server / Data Center to Confluence Cloud using the Cloud Migration Assistant, the app migration platform will coordinate with Scroll Documents to automatically transfer all the previously manually migrated documents.
h3. Current Status

Currently, Scroll Documents' support of translated content is still pending. You can track our progress here: [https://k15t.jira.com/browse/DOCS-58]

After the content is represented as a Scroll Document, the Cloud Migration Assistant can be used to automatically migrate the documents to Confluence Cloud. However, this part of the migration is currently blocked by the a bug due to which the documents (custom content object entities) are not recognized on Confluence Cloud: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/MIG-288
fields.summary: Support migration of Scroll Translations

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The new Atlassian App Migration Platform (currently under development) will enable all Atlassian Marketplace Partners apps to build automated migration paths for their apps.
h3. Suggested Solution

K15t's new-generation app *Scroll Documents* is our solution for authoring versioned content and technical communication in Confluence on all deployment types. A content migration from Scroll Versions-managed spaces to Scroll Documents is provided as a feature of Scroll Versions.

When a customer migrates from Confluence Server / Data Center to Confluence Cloud using the Cloud Migration Assistant, the app migration platform will coordinate with Scroll Documents to automatically transfer all the previously manually migrated documents.
h3. Current Status

The migration from Scroll Versions to Scroll Documents Server / Data Center has been released. It currently supports migrating version and variants. Currently we're adding support for minor features and Scroll Translations [Learn more =>|https://cloud.scrollhelp.site/migrate-to-cloud/Open-Cloud-Migration-Path-for-Scroll-Versions-Users.334412142.html]

We are fully committed to enable every Scroll Versions user to migrate to Confluence Cloud via Scroll Documents. We will continue working to improve feature parity and extend the automated migration. For more details, please visit our [Cloud Roadmap|https://cloud.scrollhelp.site/migrate-to-cloud/K15t-Cloud-Roadmap.334408653.html].
fields.summary: Support migration of Scroll Versions

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The new Atlassian App Migration Platform (currently under development) will enable all Atlassian Marketplace Partners apps to build automated migration paths for their apps.

h3. Suggested Solution
When a customer migrates from Confluence Server / Data Center to Confluence Cloud using the Cloud Migration Assistant, the app migration platform will coordinate with [SVG Out|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1213030/svg-out] to automatically transfer the app data.

h3. Current Status
Currently SVG Out macros can't be migrated automatically. The main reason is that some required parameters have different names and that the Cloud version uses attachment-Ids to reference the SVG to show while the Server / Data Center version uses attachment name and page name.

We are currently evaluating the best solution to allow an automatic migration of the majority of all cases.

h3. Workaround
Users have to re-embed all SVG Out macros. Open the macro editor, select the appropriate SVG, select width and height etc.
fields.summary: Support Migration of SVG Out

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The new Atlassian App Migration Platform (currently under development) will enable all Atlassian Marketplace Partners apps to build automated migration paths for their apps.
h3. Suggested Solution

When a customer migrates from Confluence Server / Data Center to Confluence Cloud using the Cloud Migration Assistant, the app migration platform will coordinate with Scroll Documents to automatically transfer all the documents created using the app.
h3. Current Status

The migration is *blocked* by the a bug due to which the documents (custom content object entities) are not recognized on Confluence Cloud - 

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/MIG-288

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/MIG-563

[https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/trashed-custom-content-appears-in-search-results-breaking-expansions/44947/2]
h3. Workaround

The following workaround exists for MIG-288, but is not scalable and is incompatible with the migration path offered via the Cloud Migration Assistant:
 # Create space exports from server.
 # Unzip the package created
 # In the entities.xml file manually add the prefix to all occurrences of the custom content instances
 # Repackage
 # Import to Cloud
fields.summary: Support migration of Scroll Documents

When a customer migrates from Confluence Server / Data Center to Confluence Cloud using the Cloud Migration Assistant, the app migration platform will coordinate with Scroll HTML Exporter to automatically transfer the customized export templates.
h3. Current Status

At the moment Scroll HTML Exporter is not available on Confluence Cloud. This is something we plan to work on in the future and you can track the progress for this compatibility in our public Jira tracker here - [https://k15t.jira.com/browse/EXP-632]

K15t is working on the first version of migration functionality which will allow the automatic migration of our cloud-ready apps; Scroll PDF Exporter & Scroll Word Exporter, export templates from Confluence Server/DC to Confluence Cloud. You can track this progress in our public Jira tracker here: [https://k15t.jira.com/browse/EXP-3192]

Whilst Scroll HTML Exporter for Confluence Cloud is not available and thus, there is no integration with the Migration assistant, we have documented a potential alternative that some users may be able to use as a migration path for Confluence Cloud. You can read more about this here - [https://help.k15t.com/scroll-html-exporter/can-i-use-scroll-html-exporter-on-cloud-172604643.html]

h3. Issue Summary
If customer uses JCMA to migrate a Server instance to Cloud instance still under evaluation, customer will not be able to manage its storage usage as it will show as 0.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Cloud instance and start the Standard Support Evaluation
 # Migrate a Server instance using JCMA to this site

h3. Expected Results
The Storage section will show the current usage of the Cloud site after the migration.

h3. Actual Results
Storage section will shows zero usage.

h3. Workaround
Upload any new attachment in the instance and the sync will start working.
fields.summary: Sync issues between storage and JCMA

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* The field values are not Migrated to the Cloud site when the Custom field is Hidden in the Field Configuration.
* Migrated with Jira Cloud Migration assistant

h3. Steps to Reproduce
On Server

 * Created a text field ( not
 hidden)
 * Create a project on Server
*  Add the Custom field to the required screen of the project.
 * Create issues and add data to the created Custom field. 
 * Now set the field to hidden in the project Field Configuration.
 * The data field is hidden on the Jira issues on Server. But DataBase still holds the custom field value of the issue.

Migration to Cloud
 * The Migrated Jira issue doesn't have a field visible ( because it is hidden, expected)
 * Set the field to show on the project field Configuration.
 * The values don't come back on Jira Cloud.
* Checked the Database, the field doesn't hold the value for the issue.


h3. Expected Results
 The field value has to be migrated even when the field is Hidden

h3. Actual Results
The Field is migrated but not the values.


h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Custom field hidden in the field configuration scheme (on Jira Server) is migrated to Jira Cloud via Jira Cloud Migration assistant. But without data - the field is empty in all the migrated issues on the Jira Cloud.

fields.description: As a customer if I have a quiet period from 9pm to 3am every night and then 2 days every weekend, It would be great if I could create a plan and have it run only between these times so that performance is not impacted but I can utilise the off-peak times more efficiently.
fields.summary: Ability to time-box time allowed for CCMA to operate.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

JSU provides a concept of preconditions which are on the JSU Server/DC App implemented as Post-Functions. Following Post-Functions can use the result of the Preconditions to either be executed or not.

Due to the nature of how Post-Functions work (async mode) on Jira Cloud we directly integrated the precondition into the actual Post-Function. Precondition Post-Functions are not standalone on the JSU Cloud App.

The migrated Precondition Post-Functions do not exists in the JSU Cloud App, but we required the configuration of them to merge them into the actual Post-Function on the cloud side. After finalizing the migration, the Precondition Post-Functions are no longer required and can be removed.

The removal functionality of workflow transition rule does not exists and so we are not able to provide our common customers a seamless migration.
h3. Problem Solution

provide a delete workflow transition rule endpoint ([https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-workflow-transition-rules/)] for app owned workflow transition rules for migration purposes.

this would provide us the ability to perform a proper migration of JSU precondition Post-Functions and do the required cleanups afterwards.
fields.summary: delete workflow transition rule - Jira Cloud Rest API for connect apps

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The new Atlassian App Migration Platform (currently under development) will enable all Atlassian Marketplace Partners apps to build automated migration paths for their apps.

The core functionality of Easy Agile User Story maps is based off of the data available from Jira Software and will function normally after a basic migration. The data for any Story Map Views, however, will not be migrated and would need to be re-created.
h3. What we're working towards

When Atlassian makes the Jira Cloud Migration Assistant generally available, Easy Agile will perform the work required so that the app migration platform will automatically migrate Story Map Views data for use in your Cloud instance.
h3. Workaround

There is currently no process, manual or automatic, to migrate your Story Map Views data from Server/DC to Cloud. 
h3. Read more

[Please read more here|https://docs.easyagile.com/easy-agile-user-story-maps/migrating-easy-agile-user-storymaps-between-jira-cloud-and-server%252Fdc/].

h3. Problem Definition

The new Atlassian App Migration Platform (currently under development) will enable all Atlassian Marketplace Partners apps to build automated migration paths for their apps.
h3. Suggested Solution

When a customer migrates projects from Jira Server / Data Centre to Jira Cloud using the Jira Cloud Migration Assistant, the app migration platform will coordinate with Easy Agile Programs to automatically move Program and Increment data to be used in your Cloud instance.

JCMA - Clicking on the button "Confirm" on the "Choose your destination cloud site" screen when the groups are not reviewed in the destination cloud site will not proceed with the migration

fields.description:
Similar to Site-import, it would be great if we could choose the source baseurl and JCMA could translate them to the new cloud URL during the migration. 

h2. Expected outcome
Absolute issue links are repaired after migrated to take into account change in the base URL. These links are mostly found in UGC but also in hard coded issue links (not remote / integrations)
fields.summary: Repair absolute links by supporting base URL transformation in Jira Cloud Migration Assistant

fields.description: It would be great if Mail handlers were migrated with JCMA. Currently these are not migrated and need to recreated by hand after migrating a project.
fields.summary: Jira Cloud Migration Assistant retaining mail handlers

fields.description:
While testing migrations, customers want to ensure that any selections made on this screen will not affect any of their other production sites within their cloud organization, especially if SCIM is already enabled. Support confirmed that these options only apply on a per-site basis.

The ask here is to clarify directly on the import screen (or under the corresponding ? icons) that the 3 user options only apply on a per-site basis and will not affect other production sites. The public documentation has already been updated. See Step 5, 5.b: https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/use-jira-site-import-to-migrate-from-server-to-cloud-972349848.html
fields.summary: Clarify Jira Site Import screen - user options are per site

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When exporting issues with the *Export XML* option the Request type values ins't displayed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a JSM ticket with a Request type
 # Go to Actions option "..."
 # Export XML

 !Export XML.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

The XML is generated with a value for the Request type.

h3. Actual Results

The XML is generated but there are no values for Request type:

{code:java}
<customfield id="customfield_10000" key="com.atlassian.servicedesk:vp-origin">
<customfieldname>Customer Request Type</customfieldname>
<customfieldvalues></customfieldvalues>
</customfield>{code}

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Request Type value isn't displayed using the Export XML option

fields.description: At this point, the missing attachments are not included when checking for errors. Including this functionality would save some time for users with multiple missing attachments.
fields.summary: Add into the pre-check report the option to search for missing attachments on Confluence Spaces

fields.description:
Currently, when using the CCMA, the migrations follow the trial and error approach, where it's all or nothing. 

It would be useful to be able to perform a dry-run so that users can predetermine what are the errors they might run into. 

Example:
When migrating spaces where the attachments can't be found, you can have multiple missing attachments and until you resolve all of them, the migration will keep failing.
fields.summary: Allow the option to perform a dry-run when using the CCMA

fields.description:
As a user, I'd like to be able to update issues using JSON file.

Currently, the external system import allows only to create new issues when using the JSON input method.
But, it would be good to be able to update issues as it is possible to set the issue key on the JSON file, with that, it will update only the issues and the specific content specified on the JSON field.

Due to this limitation, when importing issue history or fields and will require to adjust the issue, I have to delete all the issues and import everything again, instead of just updating the issues by setting the correct values from the existing file.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to be able to update issues using JSON file

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a migration is started and it runs through the migration checks, there is no way to abort the check and it can take hours to complete. Requesting for an enhancement to allow end users to abort a migration check to allow for better user experience. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In Jira, start a migration via JCMA
 # During the migration run, the check job would run

h3. Desired Results

Ability to abort the running job/migration check
h3. Actual Results

The end user has to wait for the checks to complete, even if they need to change something and cancel the migration
h3. Workaround

None available
fields.summary: Ability to abort a migration check in JCMA

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The new Atlassian App Migration Platform (currently under development) will enable all Atlassian Marketplace Partners apps to build automated migration paths for their apps.
h3. Suggested Solution

When a customer migrates projects from Jira Server / Data Centre to Jira Cloud using the Jira Cloud Migration Assistant, the app migration platform will coordinate with ALM Works to automatically move [Structure|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/34717/structure-project-management-at-scale?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] data associated with the migrated projects.
h3. Current Status

ALM Works team has finished working on the first version of migration functionality, which will allow to migrate Structure data using the Jira Cloud Migration Assistant (JCMA). It will be possible to migrate:
 * Manually added issues and folders
 * Items added and organized through Automation
 * The default view and associated views for each structure

This functionality will become available as soon as the app migration platform goes into beta:

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/MIG-415

*Limitations*
 * The Structure migration assistant can only add issues from projects that were migrated to Jira Cloud using the JCMA.
 * The migration assistant is available on Structure Server/Data Center versions 6.3.2+.
 * At this time, some features are not available in Structure Cloud and corresponding data won't be migrated. See [Comparison to Structure for Jira Server / Data Center|https://wiki.almworks.com/x/ULK9Aw] for more details.

**ALM Works will continue to update the migration assistant as new features and capabilities are added to Structure Cloud.
fields.summary: Support Migration of Structure

h3. Issue Summary

When upgrading an old version of CCMA to a version with App Migrations Framework, server app modules get disabled.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Start Confluence 6.14.0  standalone which has CCMA pre-installed.
 # Install server app with an implemented migration path.
 # Upgrade CCMA to 3.1.3.
 # Check the respective app modules in Manage apps.

h3. Expected Results

Server app modules are enabled.
h3. Actual Results

Server app modules are disabled.
h3. Workaround

The server app has to be disabled and enabled *manually* again so that all the server app modules are enabled.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, the CSV file import wizard allows specifying a date format (this could be _Date_ e.g "*dd/MM/yyyy*" or _Datetime_ e.g "*dd/MM/yyyy h:mm a*".
 * If you specify the _DateTime_ format: It will work for _Datetime_ fields, but fail to import _Date_ fields, and
 * If you specify _Date_ format, it will import both _Date_ and _DateTime_ fields *but* the _DateTime_ fields will be stripped of the _time_ digits. For instance, when "*dd/MM/yyyy*" is specified and you have a column with values like *25/12/2020* and another with *23/12/2020 9:15 PM*.
 ** *25/12/2020* will be imported but,
 ** *23/12/2020 9:15 PM* will be imported at *23/12/2020 00:00:00 (_23/12/2020 12:00 AM_*)

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow the ability to specify how both Date and Datetime fields will be imported, so that they can work at the same time.
h3. Why This Is Important

When importing a CSV of issues into Jira, a customer could have both _Date_ and _DateTime_ columns on the same CSV. Since the fields can't be imported correctly at the same time, the customer will have to run the import twice (see workaround). It will save time if it can be done in one go.
h3. Workaround

Import the values with 2 imports (first import for the date fields and the second for the DateTime fields, or vice versa).

To avoid duplicating the issues, the CSV file for the second import needs to contain a column that maps to *Issue Key* so that it will update existing issues (created from the first import). If an issue exists for a given key, it will be updated.

So steps to complete after the first import (assuming _Date_ fields were imported first):
 * Export all the imported issues from Jira to a CSV: 
 ** *Filters > Advanced Issue Search*.
 ** Once you have filtered the issues, export using the *Export* button on the top right corner of your Filter page.
 ** Important fields are _Project, Issue key,_ and _Summary_
 * Once exported, update the CSV file with the _Datetime field_.
 ** You can update the values by doing a *VLOOKUP in Excel* on the _Summary_ column. {color:#FF0000}_Note: this assumes that the Summary column is the best match between the 2 CSV files - CSV used for the first import and the CSV exported from Jira_{color}) 
 * Once the CSV is ready, run another import to update *only* the _Datetime_ fields.
fields.summary: Ability to import date and datetime fields at the same time

The new Atlassian App Migration Platform ([currently under development|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/MIG-261]) will enable all Atlassian Marketplace Partners apps to build automated migration paths for their apps.

h3. Workaround

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When doing a site import some customers are facing a timeout after the file gets uploaded and processed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Take a backup of Jira
# Perform a site import on the destination

h3. Expected Results

Import completes successfully.

h3. Actual Results

Import fails at the beginning of the import process.

 !timeout_error_heartbeat-1.PNG|thumbnail! 

Error logs in the backend:

{noformat}
com.atlassian.jira.httpclient.impl.UnexpectedHttpResponseException: Unexpected response received from media-api-client response with status 500
.....
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Retry the import, the error is transient and doesn't seem to be consistent.

*Notes*

It seems to be more prominently happening for large XML files.
fields.summary: Site import for Jira fails with timeout

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
JCMA 1.4.6 introduced a new feature that includes 32 workflow rules, To do so, 
 workflow XML is being opened and migrate its component as individual entities such as steps, transitions, and rules. 
But, In some server instances consist of transitions with missing steps (especially in common actions)  and it blocks the entire migration. Hence, the feature is disabled and improves workflow sanitization is in progress and expected to be incorporated back on the next release.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
The feature is disabled.

h3. Expected Results
N/A

h3. Actual Results
N/A

h3. Workaround

Manually recreate missing/important workflow rules in the cloud after migration. If you saw errors like "Reason: Collection contains no element matching the predicate.." in JCMA logs, please, retry the migration.
fields.summary: Workflow migration  with rules (JCMA 1.4.6 feature)  failed due to broken common action with missing steps

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

All default users from all project roles that exist in the Cloud can be seen in the "People" screen of the migrated project's settings, even if those people or roles don't exist on the Server.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1 - Create a project role in the Cloud instance and add default members (users) to that role
 # Step 2 - Migrate a project from Server to Cloud using JCMA
 # Step 3 - In Cloud, open up the migrated project's settings and go to "People"
 # Step 4 - Actual result: all default users from all project roles that exist in the Cloud can be seen in the "People" screen of the migrated project's settings, even if those people or roles don't exist on the Server.
 # Step 5 - This is happening even when Project Roles and/or its default users only exist in Cloud and are completely unrelated to the migrated project

h3. Expected Results

The list of users/roles for this project in the Cloud is identical to the list of users/roles in the Server.
h3. Actual Results

All default users from all project roles that exist in the Cloud can be seen in the "People" screen of the migrated project's settings, even if those people or roles don't exist on the Server.

h3. Workaround

There is no workaround available.
fields.summary: JCMA Migration - all default users from all project roles that exist in the Cloud can be seen in the "People" screen of the migrated project's settings, even if those people or roles don't exist on the Server.

fields.description:
h2. *Problem*

When custom fields are migrated from server to cloud, the IDs change. If the IDs are not updated in other entities that reference the custom field, the entity will not function properly and/or even result in a migration failure. eg. a screen scheme that specified a custom field in to be displayed in Jira Server, is not updated with the new custom field ID when it has been migrated to Cloud.
h2. What's needed

Customers want and expect the migration to maintain referential integrity for all migrated custom fields, including app custom fields. This ticket is about sending the mappings as objects IDs change as they move from Server to Cloud, so that the references can be updated and functionality preserved as the overall outcome of moving the selected project data from Server to Cloud.
fields.summary: Repair custom field references

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The title set on Jira "General Settings" is not being imported when importing a cloud backup into a cloud instance. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# At the source Jira instance, update the title to a customize one;
# Export the backup;
# Import the backup in the destination instance

h3. Expected Results
The title should be copied.

h3. Actual Results
It keeps the default Jira title. Not that the backup files don't contain the title at all.

h3. Workaround
Manually update the title after backing up
fields.summary: Title is not being imported when import a backup cloud to cloud

fields.description:
Confluence gadgets are a popular way to display different reports into Confluence pages via Jira Macros. Because of the differences between Server and Cloud, Server pages that contain references to these macros will not work post migration in Cloud.

Currently you must recreate the gadget from Confluence cloud in order to restore the functionality. This may be very difficult for any instances with thousands of gadgets.
fields.summary: Confluence gadgets do not work post-migation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When doing a migration if there are space shortcuts on the spaces being migrated, these links are not carried over to the target Cloud instance.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a space
 # Put several shortcuts in that space
 # Migrate the space to the Cloud

h3. Expected Results

Spaces shortcuts are migrated
h3. Actual Results

The shortcuts are not migrated.

No errors on the logs
h3. Request

Please, consider migrating the space short cuts
h3. Workaround

-No workaround is available yet.- Please see [Wormholes in Space a.k.a. Confluence Space Shortcuts|https://hello.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/~kplaha/blog/2021/07/14/1245063801/Wormholes+in+Space+a.k.a.+Confluence+Space+Shortcuts] for a workaround.

Getting the shortcuts from Confluence database:
{code:java}
select * from "AO_187CCC_SIDEBAR_LINK" where "CATEGORY" = 'QUICK';
{code}
OR
{code:java}
SELECT sl.*, c.title, 
       'https://mycompany.com/spaces/'||s.spacekey||'/pages/'||c.contentid AS "URL"
FROM   content c join spaces s ON c.spaceid = s.spaceid
join "AO_187CCC_SIDEBAR_LINK" sl on sl."DEST_PAGE_ID" = c.contentid
where c.contentid in (select "DEST_PAGE_ID" from "AO_187CCC_SIDEBAR_LINK" where "CATEGORY" = 'QUICK');
{code}
fields.summary: Consider migrating space shortcuts when using the Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant
